intro: Orthocarpus densiflorus var. latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound umbels of small white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and coastal sage scrub habitats. Its leaves are broad and pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small animals.
